subject: Home & DIY
title: Zigbee and Z-Wave: The Mesh Networks
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Zigbee and Z-Wave: The Mesh Networks.

hook.text: Zigbee and Z-Wave relay messages through each other. The more devices you add, the stronger your network gets.

buildup.text: In a mesh, each mains-powered device repeats signals. Data hops from device to device until reaching its destination.

discovery.text: Z-Wave limits to 4 hops but avoids interference on its private 908 MHz band. Zigbee shares crowded 2.4 GHz.

twist.text: Zigbee devices from different makers often clash. The 'standard' has been inconsistently implemented for 20 years.

climax.text: Thread fixes Zigbee's fragmentation and adds IPv6 addressing. It's the backbone of the new Matter standard.

punchline.text: More devices, stronger signalâ€”mesh networks defy logic.

quiz.question: What advantage does a mesh network gain as more devices are added?
options: Each mains-powered device acts as a repeater, strengthening coverage
The hub automatically increases its transmission power
Devices switch to a faster frequency band when congested
